newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Crossair plans unitary registered share.
newsitem.headline: Crossair plans unitary registered share.

text.p: Crossair AG, the regional airline of the SAirGroup, said its board of directors would ask the shareholders' meeting on June 10 to approve a simplification of the share structure by creating a unitary registered share.
Crossair said in a statement that SAirGroup would continue to control two thirds of the share capital and votes with a stake of 67.9 percent.
The board made the proposal after suggestion by a group of holders of bearer shares, the statement added.
The board will propose that all 76,000 bearer shares, each with a nominal value of 500 francs, be transformed into 152,000 registered shares with a nominal value of 250 francs.
Crossair's share capital at the end of 1996 comprised 76,000 bearer shares and 1,162,000 registered shares with a value of 250 francs for a total nominal capital of 328.5 million francs.
"The increase in the number of shares as a consequence of the introduction of a unitary share will raise the attractiveness of the share on the stock exchange," Crossair said.

The move, which is in line with the trend seen in small to medium-capitalised companies, would make Crossair's share structure simpler and more transparent and make a direct contact possible with all share structures.

"For the current holders of bearer shares, the transformation of their shares into registered shares will mean a loss of anyonymity, but in compensation their voting power will be increased," Crossair said.
